hw_ioc.h

36 
37 #ifndef __HW_IOC_H__
38 #define __HW_IOC_H__
39 
40 //*****************************************************************************
41 //
42 // This section defines the register offsets of
43 // IOC component
44 //
45 //*****************************************************************************
46 // Configuration of DIO0
47 #define IOC_O_IOCFG0 0x00000000
48 
49 // Configuration of DIO1
50 #define IOC_O_IOCFG1 0x00000004
51 
52 // Configuration of DIO2
53 #define IOC_O_IOCFG2 0x00000008
54 
55 // Configuration of DIO3
56 #define IOC_O_IOCFG3 0x0000000C
57 
58 // Configuration of DIO4
59 #define IOC_O_IOCFG4 0x00000010
60 
61 // Configuration of DIO5
62 #define IOC_O_IOCFG5 0x00000014
63 
64 // Configuration of DIO6
65 #define IOC_O_IOCFG6 0x00000018
66 
67 // Configuration of DIO7
68 #define IOC_O_IOCFG7 0x0000001C
69 
70 // Configuration of DIO8
71 #define IOC_O_IOCFG8 0x00000020
72 
73 // Configuration of DIO9
74 #define IOC_O_IOCFG9 0x00000024
75 
76 // Configuration of DIO10
77 #define IOC_O_IOCFG10 0x00000028
78 
79 // Configuration of DIO11
80 #define IOC_O_IOCFG11 0x0000002C
81 
82 // Configuration of DIO12
83 #define IOC_O_IOCFG12 0x00000030
84 
85 // Configuration of DIO13
86 #define IOC_O_IOCFG13 0x00000034
87 
88 // Configuration of DIO14
89 #define IOC_O_IOCFG14 0x00000038
90 
91 // Configuration of DIO15
92 #define IOC_O_IOCFG15 0x0000003C
93 
94 // Configuration of DIO16
95 #define IOC_O_IOCFG16 0x00000040
96 
97 // Configuration of DIO17
98 #define IOC_O_IOCFG17 0x00000044
99 
100 // Configuration of DIO18
101 #define IOC_O_IOCFG18 0x00000048
102 
103 // Configuration of DIO19
104 #define IOC_O_IOCFG19 0x0000004C
105 
106 // Configuration of DIO20
107 #define IOC_O_IOCFG20 0x00000050
108 
109 // Configuration of DIO21
110 #define IOC_O_IOCFG21 0x00000054
111 
112 // Configuration of DIO22
113 #define IOC_O_IOCFG22 0x00000058
114 
115 // Configuration of DIO23
116 #define IOC_O_IOCFG23 0x0000005C
117 
118 // Configuration of DIO24
119 #define IOC_O_IOCFG24 0x00000060
120 
121 // Configuration of DIO25
122 #define IOC_O_IOCFG25 0x00000064
123 
124 // Configuration of DIO26
125 #define IOC_O_IOCFG26 0x00000068
126 
127 // Configuration of DIO27
128 #define IOC_O_IOCFG27 0x0000006C
129 
130 // Configuration of DIO28
131 #define IOC_O_IOCFG28 0x00000070
132 
133 // Configuration of DIO29
134 #define IOC_O_IOCFG29 0x00000074
135 
136 // Configuration of DIO30
137 #define IOC_O_IOCFG30 0x00000078
138 
139 // Configuration of DIO31
140 #define IOC_O_IOCFG31 0x0000007C
141 
142 //*****************************************************************************
143 //
144 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG0
145 //
146 //*****************************************************************************
147 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
148 //
149 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
150 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
151 #define IOC_IOCFG0_HYST_EN 0x40000000
152 #define IOC_IOCFG0_HYST_EN_BITN 30
153 #define IOC_IOCFG0_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
154 #define IOC_IOCFG0_HYST_EN_S 30
155 
156 // Field: [29] IE
157 //
158 // 0: Input disabled
159 // 1: Input enabled
160 //
161 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
162 // ignored.
163 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IE 0x20000000
164 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IE_BITN 29
165 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IE_M 0x20000000
166 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IE_S 29
167 
168 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
169 //
170 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
171 // or >0x08:
172 //
173 // 00: No wake-up
174 // 01: No wake-up
175 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
176 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
177 //
178 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
179 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
180 //
181 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
182 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
183 //
184 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
185 //
186 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
187 // DIO.
188 #define IOC_IOCFG0_WU_CFG_W 2
189 #define IOC_IOCFG0_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
190 #define IOC_IOCFG0_WU_CFG_S 27
191 
192 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
193 //
194 // IO Mode
195 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
196 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
197 //
198 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
199 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
200 // ENUMs:
201 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
202 // Inverted input/output
203 // OPENSRC Open Source
204 // Normal input / outut
205 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
206 // Inverted input / output
207 // OPENDR Open Drain,
208 // Normal input / output
209 // INV Inverted input / ouput
210 // NORMAL Normal input / output
211 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOMODE_W 3
212 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
213 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOMODE_S 24
214 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
215 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
216 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
217 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
218 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
219 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
220 
221 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
222 //
223 // 0: No interrupt generation
224 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
225 // enabled)
226 #define IOC_IOCFG0_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
227 #define IOC_IOCFG0_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
228 #define IOC_IOCFG0_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
229 #define IOC_IOCFG0_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
230 
231 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
232 //
233 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
234 // ENUMs:
235 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
236 // POS Positive edge detection
237 // NEG Negative edge detection
238 // NONE No edge detection
239 #define IOC_IOCFG0_EDGE_DET_W 2
240 #define IOC_IOCFG0_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
241 #define IOC_IOCFG0_EDGE_DET_S 16
242 #define IOC_IOCFG0_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
243 #define IOC_IOCFG0_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
244 #define IOC_IOCFG0_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
245 #define IOC_IOCFG0_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
246 
247 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
248 //
249 // Pull control
250 // ENUMs:
251 // DIS No pull
252 // UP Pull up
253 // DWN Pull down
254 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PULL_CTL_W 2
255 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
256 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PULL_CTL_S 13
257 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
258 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
259 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
260 
261 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
262 //
263 // 0: Normal slew rate
264 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
265 #define IOC_IOCFG0_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
266 #define IOC_IOCFG0_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
267 #define IOC_IOCFG0_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
268 #define IOC_IOCFG0_SLEW_RED_S 12
269 
270 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
271 //
272 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
273 // ENUMs:
274 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
275 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
276 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
277 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
278 // to AUTO
279 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
280 // to AUTO
281 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOCURR_W 2
282 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
283 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOCURR_S 10
284 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
285 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
286 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
287 
288 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
289 //
290 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
291 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
292 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
293 // ENUMs:
294 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
295 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
296 // values)
297 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
298 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
299 // values)
300 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
301 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
302 // values)
303 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
304 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
305 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOSTR_W 2
306 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
307 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOSTR_S 8
308 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
309 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
310 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
311 #define IOC_IOCFG0_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
312 
313 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
314 //
315 // Selects usage for DIO0
316 // ENUMs:
317 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
318 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
319 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
320 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
321 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
322 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
323 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
324 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
325 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
326 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
327 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
328 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
329 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
330 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
331 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
332 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
333 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
334 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
335 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
336 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
337 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
338 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
339 // Can be used as a general
340 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
341 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
342 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
343 // etc
344 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
345 // Can be used as a general
346 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
347 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
348 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
349 // etc
350 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
351 // Can be used as a general
352 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
353 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
354 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
355 // etc
356 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
357 // Can be used as a general
358 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
359 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
360 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
361 // etc
362 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
363 // Can be used as a general
364 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
365 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
366 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
367 // etc
368 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
369 // Can be used as a general
370 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
371 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
372 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
373 // etc
374 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
375 // Can be used as a general
376 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
377 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
378 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
379 // etc
380 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
381 // Can be used as a general
382 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
383 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
384 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
385 // etc
386 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
387 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
388 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
389 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
390 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
391 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
392 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
393 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
394 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
395 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
396 // AUX_IO AUX IO
397 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
398 // GPIO General Purpose IO
399 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_W 6
400 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
401 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_S 0
402 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
403 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
404 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
405 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
406 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
407 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
408 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
409 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
410 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
411 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
412 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
413 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
414 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
415 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
416 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
417 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
418 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
419 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
420 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
421 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
422 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
423 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
424 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
425 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
426 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
427 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
428 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
429 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
430 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
431 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_UART0_RTS 0x00000012
432 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_UART0_CTS 0x00000011
433 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
434 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
435 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
436 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
437 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
438 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
439 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
440 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
441 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
442 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
443 #define IOC_IOCFG0_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
444 
445 //*****************************************************************************
446 //
447 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG1
448 //
449 //*****************************************************************************
450 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
451 //
452 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
453 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
454 #define IOC_IOCFG1_HYST_EN 0x40000000
455 #define IOC_IOCFG1_HYST_EN_BITN 30
456 #define IOC_IOCFG1_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
457 #define IOC_IOCFG1_HYST_EN_S 30
458 
459 // Field: [29] IE
460 //
461 // 0: Input disabled
462 // 1: Input enabled
463 //
464 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
465 // ignored.
466 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IE 0x20000000
467 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IE_BITN 29
468 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IE_M 0x20000000
469 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IE_S 29
470 
471 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
472 //
473 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
474 // or >0x08:
475 //
476 // 00: No wake-up
477 // 01: No wake-up
478 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
479 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
480 //
481 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
482 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
483 //
484 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
485 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
486 //
487 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
488 //
489 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
490 // DIO.
491 #define IOC_IOCFG1_WU_CFG_W 2
492 #define IOC_IOCFG1_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
493 #define IOC_IOCFG1_WU_CFG_S 27
494 
495 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
496 //
497 // IO Mode
498 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
499 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
500 //
501 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
502 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
503 // ENUMs:
504 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
505 // Inverted input / output
506 // OPENSRC Open Source
507 // Normal input / output
508 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
509 // Inverted input / output
510 // OPENDR Open Drain,
511 // Normal input / output
512 // INV Inverted input / ouput
513 // NORMAL Normal input / output
514 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOMODE_W 3
515 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
516 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOMODE_S 24
517 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
518 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
519 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
520 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
521 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
522 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
523 
524 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
525 //
526 // 0: No interrupt generation
527 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
528 // enabled)
529 #define IOC_IOCFG1_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
530 #define IOC_IOCFG1_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
531 #define IOC_IOCFG1_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
532 #define IOC_IOCFG1_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
533 
534 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
535 //
536 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
537 // ENUMs:
538 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
539 // POS Positive edge detection
540 // NEG Negative edge detection
541 // NONE No edge detection
542 #define IOC_IOCFG1_EDGE_DET_W 2
543 #define IOC_IOCFG1_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
544 #define IOC_IOCFG1_EDGE_DET_S 16
545 #define IOC_IOCFG1_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
546 #define IOC_IOCFG1_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
547 #define IOC_IOCFG1_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
548 #define IOC_IOCFG1_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
549 
550 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
551 //
552 // Pull control
553 // ENUMs:
554 // DIS No pull
555 // UP Pull up
556 // DWN Pull down
557 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PULL_CTL_W 2
558 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
559 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PULL_CTL_S 13
560 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
561 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
562 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
563 
564 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
565 //
566 // 0: Normal slew rate
567 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
568 #define IOC_IOCFG1_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
569 #define IOC_IOCFG1_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
570 #define IOC_IOCFG1_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
571 #define IOC_IOCFG1_SLEW_RED_S 12
572 
573 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
574 //
575 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
576 // ENUMs:
577 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
578 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
579 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
580 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
581 // to AUTO
582 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
583 // to AUTO
584 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOCURR_W 2
585 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
586 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOCURR_S 10
587 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
588 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
589 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
590 
591 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
592 //
593 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
594 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
595 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
596 // ENUMs:
597 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
598 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
599 // values)
600 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
601 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
602 // values)
603 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
604 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
605 // values)
606 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
607 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
608 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOSTR_W 2
609 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
610 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOSTR_S 8
611 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
612 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
613 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
614 #define IOC_IOCFG1_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
615 
616 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
617 //
618 // Selects usage for DIO1
619 // ENUMs:
620 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
621 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
622 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
623 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
624 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
625 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
626 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
627 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
628 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
629 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
630 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
631 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
632 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
633 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
634 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
635 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
636 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
637 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
638 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
639 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
640 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
641 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
642 // Can be used as a general
643 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
644 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
645 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
646 // etc
647 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
648 // Can be used as a general
649 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
650 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
651 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
652 // etc
653 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
654 // Can be used as a general
655 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
656 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
657 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
658 // etc
659 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
660 // Can be used as a general
661 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
662 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
663 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
664 // etc
665 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
666 // Can be used as a general
667 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
668 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
669 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
670 // etc
671 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
672 // Can be used as a general
673 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
674 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
675 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
676 // etc
677 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
678 // Can be used as a general
679 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
680 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
681 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
682 // etc
683 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
684 // Can be used as a general
685 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
686 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
687 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
688 // etc
689 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
690 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
691 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
692 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
693 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
694 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
695 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
696 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
697 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
698 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
699 // AUX_IO AUX IO
700 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
701 // GPIO General Purpose IO
702 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_W 6
703 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
704 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_S 0
705 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
706 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
707 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
708 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
709 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
710 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
711 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
712 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
713 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
714 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
715 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
716 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
717 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
718 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
719 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
720 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
721 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
722 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
723 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
724 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
725 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
726 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
727 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
728 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
729 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
730 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
731 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
732 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
733 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
734 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_UART0_RTS 0x00000012
735 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_UART0_CTS 0x00000011
736 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
737 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
738 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
739 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
740 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
741 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
742 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
743 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
744 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
745 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
746 #define IOC_IOCFG1_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
747 
748 //*****************************************************************************
749 //
750 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG2
751 //
752 //*****************************************************************************
753 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
754 //
755 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
756 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
757 #define IOC_IOCFG2_HYST_EN 0x40000000
758 #define IOC_IOCFG2_HYST_EN_BITN 30
759 #define IOC_IOCFG2_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
760 #define IOC_IOCFG2_HYST_EN_S 30
761 
762 // Field: [29] IE
763 //
764 // 0: Input disabled
765 // 1: Input enabled
766 //
767 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
768 // ignored.
769 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IE 0x20000000
770 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IE_BITN 29
771 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IE_M 0x20000000
772 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IE_S 29
773 
774 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
775 //
776 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
777 // or >0x08:
778 //
779 // 00: No wake-up
780 // 01: No wake-up
781 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
782 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
783 //
784 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
785 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
786 //
787 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
788 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
789 //
790 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
791 //
792 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
793 // DIO.
794 #define IOC_IOCFG2_WU_CFG_W 2
795 #define IOC_IOCFG2_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
796 #define IOC_IOCFG2_WU_CFG_S 27
797 
798 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
799 //
800 // IO Mode
801 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
802 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
803 //
804 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
805 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
806 // ENUMs:
807 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
808 // Inverted input / output
809 // OPENSRC Open Source
810 // Normal input / output
811 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
812 // Inverted input / output
813 // OPENDR Open Drain,
814 // Normal input / output
815 // INV Inverted input / ouput
816 // NORMAL Normal input / output
817 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOMODE_W 3
818 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
819 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOMODE_S 24
820 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
821 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
822 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
823 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
824 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
825 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
826 
827 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
828 //
829 // 0: No interrupt generation
830 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
831 // enabled)
832 #define IOC_IOCFG2_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
833 #define IOC_IOCFG2_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
834 #define IOC_IOCFG2_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
835 #define IOC_IOCFG2_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
836 
837 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
838 //
839 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
840 // ENUMs:
841 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
842 // POS Positive edge detection
843 // NEG Negative edge detection
844 // NONE No edge detection
845 #define IOC_IOCFG2_EDGE_DET_W 2
846 #define IOC_IOCFG2_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
847 #define IOC_IOCFG2_EDGE_DET_S 16
848 #define IOC_IOCFG2_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
849 #define IOC_IOCFG2_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
850 #define IOC_IOCFG2_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
851 #define IOC_IOCFG2_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
852 
853 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
854 //
855 // Pull control
856 // ENUMs:
857 // DIS No pull
858 // UP Pull up
859 // DWN Pull down
860 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PULL_CTL_W 2
861 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
862 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PULL_CTL_S 13
863 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
864 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
865 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
866 
867 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
868 //
869 // 0: Normal slew rate
870 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
871 #define IOC_IOCFG2_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
872 #define IOC_IOCFG2_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
873 #define IOC_IOCFG2_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
874 #define IOC_IOCFG2_SLEW_RED_S 12
875 
876 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
877 //
878 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
879 // ENUMs:
880 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
881 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
882 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
883 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
884 // to AUTO
885 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
886 // to AUTO
887 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOCURR_W 2
888 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
889 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOCURR_S 10
890 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
891 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
892 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
893 
894 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
895 //
896 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
897 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
898 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
899 // ENUMs:
900 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
901 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
902 // values)
903 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
904 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
905 // values)
906 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
907 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
908 // values)
909 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
910 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
911 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOSTR_W 2
912 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
913 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOSTR_S 8
914 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
915 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
916 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
917 #define IOC_IOCFG2_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
918 
919 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
920 //
921 // Selects usage for DIO2
922 // ENUMs:
923 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
924 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
925 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
926 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
927 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
928 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
929 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
930 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
931 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
932 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
933 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
934 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
935 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
936 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
937 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
938 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
939 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
940 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
941 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
942 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
943 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
944 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
945 // Can be used as a general
946 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
947 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
948 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
949 // etc
950 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
951 // Can be used as a general
952 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
953 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
954 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
955 // etc
956 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
957 // Can be used as a general
958 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
959 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
960 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
961 // etc
962 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
963 // Can be used as a general
964 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
965 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
966 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
967 // etc
968 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
969 // Can be used as a general
970 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
971 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
972 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
973 // etc
974 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
975 // Can be used as a general
976 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
977 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
978 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
979 // etc
980 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
981 // Can be used as a general
982 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
983 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
984 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
985 // etc
986 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
987 // Can be used as a general
988 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
989 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
990 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
991 // etc
992 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
993 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
994 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
995 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
996 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
997 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
998 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
999 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
1000 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
1001 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
1002 // AUX_IO AUX IO
1003 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
1004 // GPIO General Purpose IO
1005 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_W 6
1006 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
1007 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_S 0
1008 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
1009 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
1010 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
1011 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
1012 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
1013 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
1014 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
1015 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
1016 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
1017 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
1018 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
1019 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
1020 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
1021 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
1022 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
1023 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
1024 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
1025 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
1026 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
1027 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
1028 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
1029 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
1030 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
1031 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
1032 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
1033 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
1034 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
1035 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
1036 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
1037 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_UART0_RTS 0x00000012
1038 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_UART0_CTS 0x00000011
1039 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
1040 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
1041 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
1042 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
1043 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
1044 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
1045 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
1046 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
1047 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
1048 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
1049 #define IOC_IOCFG2_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
1050 
1051 //*****************************************************************************
1052 //
1053 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG3
1054 //
1055 //*****************************************************************************
1056 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
1057 //
1058 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
1059 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
1060 #define IOC_IOCFG3_HYST_EN 0x40000000
1061 #define IOC_IOCFG3_HYST_EN_BITN 30
1062 #define IOC_IOCFG3_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
1063 #define IOC_IOCFG3_HYST_EN_S 30
1064 
1065 // Field: [29] IE
1066 //
1067 // 0: Input disabled
1068 // 1: Input enabled
1069 //
1070 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
1071 // ignored.
1072 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IE 0x20000000
1073 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IE_BITN 29
1074 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IE_M 0x20000000
1075 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IE_S 29
1076 
1077 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
1078 //
1079 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
1080 // or >0x08:
1081 //
1082 // 00: No wake-up
1083 // 01: No wake-up
1084 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
1085 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
1086 //
1087 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
1088 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
1089 //
1090 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
1091 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
1092 //
1093 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
1094 //
1095 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
1096 // DIO.
1097 #define IOC_IOCFG3_WU_CFG_W 2
1098 #define IOC_IOCFG3_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
1099 #define IOC_IOCFG3_WU_CFG_S 27
1100 
1101 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
1102 //
1103 // IO Mode
1104 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
1105 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
1106 //
1107 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
1108 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
1109 // ENUMs:
1110 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
1111 // Inverted input / output
1112 // OPENSRC Open Source
1113 // Normal input / output
1114 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
1115 // Inverted input / output
1116 // OPENDR Open Drain,
1117 // Normal input / output
1118 // INV Inverted input / ouput
1119 // NORMAL Normal input / output
1120 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOMODE_W 3
1121 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
1122 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOMODE_S 24
1123 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
1124 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
1125 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
1126 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
1127 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
1128 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
1129 
1130 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
1131 //
1132 // 0: No interrupt generation
1133 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
1134 // enabled)
1135 #define IOC_IOCFG3_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
1136 #define IOC_IOCFG3_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
1137 #define IOC_IOCFG3_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
1138 #define IOC_IOCFG3_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
1139 
1140 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
1141 //
1142 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
1143 // ENUMs:
1144 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
1145 // POS Positive edge detection
1146 // NEG Negative edge detection
1147 // NONE No edge detection
1148 #define IOC_IOCFG3_EDGE_DET_W 2
1149 #define IOC_IOCFG3_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
1150 #define IOC_IOCFG3_EDGE_DET_S 16
1151 #define IOC_IOCFG3_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
1152 #define IOC_IOCFG3_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
1153 #define IOC_IOCFG3_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
1154 #define IOC_IOCFG3_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
1155 
1156 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
1157 //
1158 // Pull control
1159 // ENUMs:
1160 // DIS No pull
1161 // UP Pull up
1162 // DWN Pull down
1163 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PULL_CTL_W 2
1164 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
1165 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PULL_CTL_S 13
1166 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
1167 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
1168 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
1169 
1170 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
1171 //
1172 // 0: Normal slew rate
1173 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
1174 #define IOC_IOCFG3_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
1175 #define IOC_IOCFG3_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
1176 #define IOC_IOCFG3_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
1177 #define IOC_IOCFG3_SLEW_RED_S 12
1178 
1179 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
1180 //
1181 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
1182 // ENUMs:
1183 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
1184 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
1185 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
1186 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
1187 // to AUTO
1188 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
1189 // to AUTO
1190 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOCURR_W 2
1191 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
1192 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOCURR_S 10
1193 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
1194 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
1195 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
1196 
1197 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
1198 //
1199 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
1200 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
1201 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
1202 // ENUMs:
1203 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
1204 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
1205 // values)
1206 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
1207 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
1208 // values)
1209 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
1210 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
1211 // values)
1212 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
1213 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
1214 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOSTR_W 2
1215 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
1216 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOSTR_S 8
1217 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
1218 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
1219 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
1220 #define IOC_IOCFG3_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
1221 
1222 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
1223 //
1224 // Selects usage for DIO3
1225 // ENUMs:
1226 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
1227 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
1228 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
1229 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
1230 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
1231 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
1232 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
1233 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
1234 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
1235 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
1236 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
1237 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
1238 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
1239 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
1240 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
1241 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
1242 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
1243 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
1244 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
1245 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
1246 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
1247 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
1248 // Can be used as a general
1249 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1250 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1251 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1252 // etc
1253 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
1254 // Can be used as a general
1255 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1256 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1257 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1258 // etc
1259 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
1260 // Can be used as a general
1261 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1262 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1263 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1264 // etc
1265 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
1266 // Can be used as a general
1267 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1268 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1269 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1270 // etc
1271 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
1272 // Can be used as a general
1273 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1274 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1275 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1276 // etc
1277 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
1278 // Can be used as a general
1279 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1280 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1281 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1282 // etc
1283 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
1284 // Can be used as a general
1285 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1286 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1287 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1288 // etc
1289 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
1290 // Can be used as a general
1291 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1292 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1293 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1294 // etc
1295 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
1296 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
1297 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
1298 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
1299 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
1300 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
1301 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
1302 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
1303 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
1304 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
1305 // AUX_IO AUX IO
1306 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
1307 // GPIO General Purpose IO
1308 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_W 6
1309 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
1310 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_S 0
1311 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
1312 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
1313 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
1314 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
1315 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
1316 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
1317 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
1318 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
1319 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
1320 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
1321 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
1322 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
1323 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
1324 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
1325 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
1326 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
1327 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
1328 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
1329 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
1330 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
1331 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
1332 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
1333 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
1334 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
1335 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
1336 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
1337 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
1338 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
1339 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
1340 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_UART0_RTS 0x00000012
1341 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_UART0_CTS 0x00000011
1342 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
1343 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
1344 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
1345 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
1346 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
1347 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
1348 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
1349 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
1350 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
1351 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
1352 #define IOC_IOCFG3_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
1353 
1354 //*****************************************************************************
1355 //
1356 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG4
1357 //
1358 //*****************************************************************************
1359 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
1360 //
1361 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
1362 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
1363 #define IOC_IOCFG4_HYST_EN 0x40000000
1364 #define IOC_IOCFG4_HYST_EN_BITN 30
1365 #define IOC_IOCFG4_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
1366 #define IOC_IOCFG4_HYST_EN_S 30
1367 
1368 // Field: [29] IE
1369 //
1370 // 0: Input disabled
1371 // 1: Input enabled
1372 //
1373 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
1374 // ignored.
1375 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IE 0x20000000
1376 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IE_BITN 29
1377 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IE_M 0x20000000
1378 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IE_S 29
1379 
1380 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
1381 //
1382 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
1383 // or >0x08:
1384 //
1385 // 00: No wake-up
1386 // 01: No wake-up
1387 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
1388 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
1389 //
1390 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
1391 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
1392 //
1393 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
1394 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
1395 //
1396 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
1397 //
1398 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
1399 // DIO.
1400 #define IOC_IOCFG4_WU_CFG_W 2
1401 #define IOC_IOCFG4_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
1402 #define IOC_IOCFG4_WU_CFG_S 27
1403 
1404 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
1405 //
1406 // IO Mode
1407 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
1408 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
1409 //
1410 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
1411 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
1412 // ENUMs:
1413 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
1414 // Inverted input / output
1415 // OPENSRC Open Source
1416 // Normal input / output
1417 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
1418 // Inverted input / output
1419 // OPENDR Open Drain,
1420 // Normal input / output
1421 // INV Inverted input / ouput
1422 // NORMAL Normal input / output
1423 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOMODE_W 3
1424 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
1425 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOMODE_S 24
1426 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
1427 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
1428 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
1429 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
1430 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
1431 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
1432 
1433 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
1434 //
1435 // 0: No interrupt generation
1436 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
1437 // enabled)
1438 #define IOC_IOCFG4_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
1439 #define IOC_IOCFG4_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
1440 #define IOC_IOCFG4_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
1441 #define IOC_IOCFG4_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
1442 
1443 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
1444 //
1445 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
1446 // ENUMs:
1447 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
1448 // POS Positive edge detection
1449 // NEG Negative edge detection
1450 // NONE No edge detection
1451 #define IOC_IOCFG4_EDGE_DET_W 2
1452 #define IOC_IOCFG4_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
1453 #define IOC_IOCFG4_EDGE_DET_S 16
1454 #define IOC_IOCFG4_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
1455 #define IOC_IOCFG4_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
1456 #define IOC_IOCFG4_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
1457 #define IOC_IOCFG4_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
1458 
1459 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
1460 //
1461 // Pull control
1462 // ENUMs:
1463 // DIS No pull
1464 // UP Pull up
1465 // DWN Pull down
1466 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PULL_CTL_W 2
1467 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
1468 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PULL_CTL_S 13
1469 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
1470 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
1471 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
1472 
1473 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
1474 //
1475 // 0: Normal slew rate
1476 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
1477 #define IOC_IOCFG4_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
1478 #define IOC_IOCFG4_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
1479 #define IOC_IOCFG4_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
1480 #define IOC_IOCFG4_SLEW_RED_S 12
1481 
1482 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
1483 //
1484 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
1485 // ENUMs:
1486 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
1487 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
1488 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
1489 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
1490 // to AUTO
1491 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
1492 // to AUTO
1493 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOCURR_W 2
1494 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
1495 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOCURR_S 10
1496 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
1497 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
1498 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
1499 
1500 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
1501 //
1502 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
1503 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
1504 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
1505 // ENUMs:
1506 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
1507 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
1508 // values)
1509 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
1510 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
1511 // values)
1512 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
1513 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
1514 // values)
1515 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
1516 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
1517 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOSTR_W 2
1518 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
1519 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOSTR_S 8
1520 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
1521 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
1522 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
1523 #define IOC_IOCFG4_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
1524 
1525 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
1526 //
1527 // Selects usage for DIO4
1528 // ENUMs:
1529 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
1530 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
1531 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
1532 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
1533 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
1534 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
1535 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
1536 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
1537 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
1538 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
1539 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
1540 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
1541 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
1542 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
1543 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
1544 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
1545 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
1546 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
1547 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
1548 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
1549 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
1550 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
1551 // Can be used as a general
1552 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1553 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1554 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1555 // etc
1556 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
1557 // Can be used as a general
1558 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1559 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1560 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1561 // etc
1562 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
1563 // Can be used as a general
1564 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1565 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1566 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1567 // etc
1568 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
1569 // Can be used as a general
1570 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1571 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1572 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1573 // etc
1574 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
1575 // Can be used as a general
1576 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1577 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1578 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1579 // etc
1580 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
1581 // Can be used as a general
1582 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1583 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1584 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1585 // etc
1586 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
1587 // Can be used as a general
1588 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1589 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1590 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1591 // etc
1592 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
1593 // Can be used as a general
1594 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1595 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1596 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1597 // etc
1598 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
1599 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
1600 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
1601 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
1602 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
1603 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
1604 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
1605 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
1606 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
1607 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
1608 // AUX_IO AUX IO
1609 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
1610 // GPIO General Purpose IO
1611 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_W 6
1612 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
1613 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_S 0
1614 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
1615 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
1616 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
1617 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
1618 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
1619 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
1620 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
1621 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
1622 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
1623 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
1624 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
1625 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
1626 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
1627 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
1628 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
1629 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
1630 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
1631 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
1632 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
1633 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
1634 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
1635 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
1636 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
1637 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
1638 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
1639 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
1640 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
1641 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
1642 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
1643 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_UART0_RTS 0x00000012
1644 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_UART0_CTS 0x00000011
1645 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
1646 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
1647 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
1648 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
1649 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
1650 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
1651 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
1652 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
1653 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
1654 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
1655 #define IOC_IOCFG4_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
1656 
1657 //*****************************************************************************
1658 //
1659 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG5
1660 //
1661 //*****************************************************************************
1662 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
1663 //
1664 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
1665 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
1666 #define IOC_IOCFG5_HYST_EN 0x40000000
1667 #define IOC_IOCFG5_HYST_EN_BITN 30
1668 #define IOC_IOCFG5_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
1669 #define IOC_IOCFG5_HYST_EN_S 30
1670 
1671 // Field: [29] IE
1672 //
1673 // 0: Input disabled
1674 // 1: Input enabled
1675 //
1676 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
1677 // ignored.
1678 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IE 0x20000000
1679 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IE_BITN 29
1680 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IE_M 0x20000000
1681 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IE_S 29
1682 
1683 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
1684 //
1685 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
1686 // or >0x08:
1687 //
1688 // 00: No wake-up
1689 // 01: No wake-up
1690 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
1691 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
1692 //
1693 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
1694 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
1695 //
1696 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
1697 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
1698 //
1699 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
1700 //
1701 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
1702 // DIO.
1703 #define IOC_IOCFG5_WU_CFG_W 2
1704 #define IOC_IOCFG5_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
1705 #define IOC_IOCFG5_WU_CFG_S 27
1706 
1707 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
1708 //
1709 // IO Mode
1710 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
1711 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
1712 //
1713 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
1714 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
1715 // ENUMs:
1716 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
1717 // Inverted input / output
1718 // OPENSRC Open Source
1719 // Normal input / output
1720 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
1721 // Inverted input / output
1722 // OPENDR Open Drain,
1723 // Normal input / output
1724 // INV Inverted input / ouput
1725 // NORMAL Normal input / output
1726 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOMODE_W 3
1727 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
1728 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOMODE_S 24
1729 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
1730 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
1731 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
1732 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
1733 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
1734 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
1735 
1736 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
1737 //
1738 // 0: No interrupt generation
1739 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
1740 // enabled)
1741 #define IOC_IOCFG5_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
1742 #define IOC_IOCFG5_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
1743 #define IOC_IOCFG5_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
1744 #define IOC_IOCFG5_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
1745 
1746 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
1747 //
1748 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
1749 // ENUMs:
1750 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
1751 // POS Positive edge detection
1752 // NEG Negative edge detection
1753 // NONE No edge detection
1754 #define IOC_IOCFG5_EDGE_DET_W 2
1755 #define IOC_IOCFG5_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
1756 #define IOC_IOCFG5_EDGE_DET_S 16
1757 #define IOC_IOCFG5_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
1758 #define IOC_IOCFG5_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
1759 #define IOC_IOCFG5_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
1760 #define IOC_IOCFG5_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
1761 
1762 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
1763 //
1764 // Pull control
1765 // ENUMs:
1766 // DIS No pull
1767 // UP Pull up
1768 // DWN Pull down
1769 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PULL_CTL_W 2
1770 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
1771 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PULL_CTL_S 13
1772 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
1773 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
1774 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
1775 
1776 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
1777 //
1778 // 0: Normal slew rate
1779 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
1780 #define IOC_IOCFG5_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
1781 #define IOC_IOCFG5_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
1782 #define IOC_IOCFG5_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
1783 #define IOC_IOCFG5_SLEW_RED_S 12
1784 
1785 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
1786 //
1787 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
1788 // ENUMs:
1789 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
1790 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
1791 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
1792 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
1793 // to AUTO
1794 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
1795 // to AUTO
1796 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOCURR_W 2
1797 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
1798 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOCURR_S 10
1799 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
1800 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
1801 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
1802 
1803 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
1804 //
1805 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
1806 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
1807 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
1808 // ENUMs:
1809 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
1810 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
1811 // values)
1812 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
1813 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
1814 // values)
1815 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
1816 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
1817 // values)
1818 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
1819 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
1820 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOSTR_W 2
1821 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
1822 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOSTR_S 8
1823 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
1824 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
1825 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
1826 #define IOC_IOCFG5_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
1827 
1828 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
1829 //
1830 // Selects usage for DIO5
1831 // ENUMs:
1832 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
1833 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
1834 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
1835 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
1836 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
1837 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
1838 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
1839 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
1840 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
1841 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
1842 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
1843 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
1844 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
1845 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
1846 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
1847 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
1848 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
1849 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
1850 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
1851 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
1852 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
1853 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
1854 // Can be used as a general
1855 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1856 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1857 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1858 // etc
1859 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
1860 // Can be used as a general
1861 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1862 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1863 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1864 // etc
1865 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
1866 // Can be used as a general
1867 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1868 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1869 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1870 // etc
1871 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
1872 // Can be used as a general
1873 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1874 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1875 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1876 // etc
1877 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
1878 // Can be used as a general
1879 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1880 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1881 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1882 // etc
1883 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
1884 // Can be used as a general
1885 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1886 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1887 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1888 // etc
1889 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
1890 // Can be used as a general
1891 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1892 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1893 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1894 // etc
1895 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
1896 // Can be used as a general
1897 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
1898 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
1899 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
1900 // etc
1901 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
1902 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
1903 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
1904 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
1905 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
1906 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
1907 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
1908 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
1909 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
1910 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
1911 // AUX_IO AUX IO
1912 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
1913 // GPIO General Purpose IO
1914 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_W 6
1915 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
1916 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_S 0
1917 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
1918 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
1919 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
1920 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
1921 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
1922 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
1923 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
1924 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
1925 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
1926 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
1927 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
1928 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
1929 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
1930 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
1931 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
1932 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
1933 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
1934 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
1935 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
1936 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
1937 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
1938 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
1939 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
1940 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
1941 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
1942 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
1943 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
1944 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
1945 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
1946 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_UART0_RTS 0x00000012
1947 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_UART0_CTS 0x00000011
1948 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
1949 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
1950 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
1951 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
1952 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
1953 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
1954 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
1955 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
1956 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
1957 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
1958 #define IOC_IOCFG5_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
1959 
1960 //*****************************************************************************
1961 //
1962 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG6
1963 //
1964 //*****************************************************************************
1965 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
1966 //
1967 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
1968 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
1969 #define IOC_IOCFG6_HYST_EN 0x40000000
1970 #define IOC_IOCFG6_HYST_EN_BITN 30
1971 #define IOC_IOCFG6_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
1972 #define IOC_IOCFG6_HYST_EN_S 30
1973 
1974 // Field: [29] IE
1975 //
1976 // 0: Input disabled
1977 // 1: Input enabled
1978 //
1979 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
1980 // ignored.
1981 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IE 0x20000000
1982 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IE_BITN 29
1983 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IE_M 0x20000000
1984 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IE_S 29
1985 
1986 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
1987 //
1988 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
1989 // or >0x08:
1990 //
1991 // 00: No wake-up
1992 // 01: No wake-up
1993 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
1994 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
1995 //
1996 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
1997 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
1998 //
1999 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
2000 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
2001 //
2002 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
2003 //
2004 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
2005 // DIO.
2006 #define IOC_IOCFG6_WU_CFG_W 2
2007 #define IOC_IOCFG6_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
2008 #define IOC_IOCFG6_WU_CFG_S 27
2009 
2010 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
2011 //
2012 // IO Mode
2013 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
2014 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
2015 //
2016 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
2017 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
2018 // ENUMs:
2019 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
2020 // Inverted input / output
2021 // OPENSRC Open Source
2022 // Normal input / output
2023 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
2024 // Inverted input / output
2025 // OPENDR Open Drain,
2026 // Normal input / output
2027 // INV Inverted input / ouput
2028 // NORMAL Normal input / output
2029 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOMODE_W 3
2030 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
2031 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOMODE_S 24
2032 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
2033 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
2034 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
2035 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
2036 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
2037 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
2038 
2039 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
2040 //
2041 // 0: No interrupt generation
2042 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
2043 // enabled)
2044 #define IOC_IOCFG6_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
2045 #define IOC_IOCFG6_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
2046 #define IOC_IOCFG6_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
2047 #define IOC_IOCFG6_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
2048 
2049 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
2050 //
2051 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
2052 // ENUMs:
2053 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
2054 // POS Positive edge detection
2055 // NEG Negative edge detection
2056 // NONE No edge detection
2057 #define IOC_IOCFG6_EDGE_DET_W 2
2058 #define IOC_IOCFG6_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
2059 #define IOC_IOCFG6_EDGE_DET_S 16
2060 #define IOC_IOCFG6_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
2061 #define IOC_IOCFG6_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
2062 #define IOC_IOCFG6_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
2063 #define IOC_IOCFG6_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
2064 
2065 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
2066 //
2067 // Pull control
2068 // ENUMs:
2069 // DIS No pull
2070 // UP Pull up
2071 // DWN Pull down
2072 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PULL_CTL_W 2
2073 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
2074 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PULL_CTL_S 13
2075 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
2076 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
2077 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
2078 
2079 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
2080 //
2081 // 0: Normal slew rate
2082 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
2083 #define IOC_IOCFG6_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
2084 #define IOC_IOCFG6_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
2085 #define IOC_IOCFG6_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
2086 #define IOC_IOCFG6_SLEW_RED_S 12
2087 
2088 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
2089 //
2090 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
2091 // ENUMs:
2092 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
2093 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
2094 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
2095 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
2096 // to AUTO
2097 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
2098 // to AUTO
2099 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOCURR_W 2
2100 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
2101 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOCURR_S 10
2102 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
2103 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
2104 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
2105 
2106 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
2107 //
2108 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
2109 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
2110 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
2111 // ENUMs:
2112 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
2113 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
2114 // values)
2115 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
2116 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
2117 // values)
2118 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
2119 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
2120 // values)
2121 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
2122 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
2123 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOSTR_W 2
2124 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
2125 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOSTR_S 8
2126 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
2127 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
2128 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
2129 #define IOC_IOCFG6_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
2130 
2131 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
2132 //
2133 // Selects usage for DIO6
2134 // ENUMs:
2135 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
2136 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
2137 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
2138 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
2139 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
2140 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
2141 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
2142 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
2143 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
2144 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
2145 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
2146 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
2147 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
2148 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
2149 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
2150 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
2151 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
2152 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
2153 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
2154 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
2155 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
2156 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
2157 // Can be used as a general
2158 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
2159 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
2160 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
2161 // etc
2162 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
2163 // Can be used as a general
2164 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
2165 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
2166 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
2167 // etc
2168 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
2169 // Can be used as a general
2170 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
2171 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
2172 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
2173 // etc
2174 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
2175 // Can be used as a general
2176 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
2177 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
2178 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
2179 // etc
2180 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
2181 // Can be used as a general
2182 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
2183 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
2184 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
2185 // etc
2186 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
2187 // Can be used as a general
2188 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
2189 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
2190 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
2191 // etc
2192 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
2193 // Can be used as a general
2194 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
2195 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
2196 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
2197 // etc
2198 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
2199 // Can be used as a general
2200 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
2201 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
2202 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
2203 // etc
2204 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
2205 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
2206 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
2207 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
2208 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
2209 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
2210 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
2211 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
2212 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
2213 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
2214 // AUX_IO AUX IO
2215 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
2216 // GPIO General Purpose IO
2217 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_W 6
2218 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
2219 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_S 0
2220 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
2221 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
2222 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
2223 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
2224 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
2225 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
2226 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
2227 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
2228 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
2229 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
2230 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
2231 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
2232 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
2233 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
2234 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
2235 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
2236 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
2237 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
2238 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
2239 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
2240 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
2241 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
2242 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
2243 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
2244 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
2245 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
2246 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
2247 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
2248 #define IOC_IOCFG6_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
