8008 #define IOC_IOCFG25_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
8009 #define IOC_IOCFG25_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
8010 #define IOC_IOCFG25_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
8011 #define IOC_IOCFG25_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
8012 #define IOC_IOCFG25_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
8013 #define IOC_IOCFG25_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
8014 #define IOC_IOCFG25_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
8015 #define IOC_IOCFG25_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
8016 #define IOC_IOCFG25_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
8017 #define IOC_IOCFG25_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
8018 #define IOC_IOCFG25_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
8019 
8020 //*****************************************************************************
8021 //
8022 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG26
8023 //
8024 //*****************************************************************************
8025 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
8026 //
8027 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
8028 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
8029 #define IOC_IOCFG26_HYST_EN 0x40000000
8030 #define IOC_IOCFG26_HYST_EN_BITN 30
8031 #define IOC_IOCFG26_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
8032 #define IOC_IOCFG26_HYST_EN_S 30
8033 
8034 // Field: [29] IE
8035 //
8036 // 0: Input disabled
8037 // 1: Input enabled
8038 //
8039 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
8040 // ignored.
8041 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IE 0x20000000
8042 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IE_BITN 29
8043 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IE_M 0x20000000
8044 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IE_S 29
8045 
8046 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
8047 //
8048 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
8049 // or >0x08:
8050 //
8051 // 00: No wake-up
8052 // 01: No wake-up
8053 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
8054 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
8055 //
8056 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
8057 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
8058 //
8059 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
8060 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
8061 //
8062 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
8063 //
8064 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
8065 // DIO.
8066 #define IOC_IOCFG26_WU_CFG_W 2
8067 #define IOC_IOCFG26_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
8068 #define IOC_IOCFG26_WU_CFG_S 27
8069 
8070 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
8071 //
8072 // IO Mode
8073 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
8074 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
8075 //
8076 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
8077 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
8078 // ENUMs:
8079 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
8080 // Inverted input / output
8081 // OPENSRC Open Source
8082 // Normal input / output
8083 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
8084 // Inverted input / output
8085 // OPENDR Open Drain,
8086 // Normal input / output
8087 // INV Inverted input / ouput
8088 // NORMAL Normal input / output
8089 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOMODE_W 3
8090 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
8091 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOMODE_S 24
8092 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
8093 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
8094 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
8095 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
8096 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
8097 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
8098 
8099 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
8100 //
8101 // 0: No interrupt generation
8102 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
8103 // enabled)
8104 #define IOC_IOCFG26_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
8105 #define IOC_IOCFG26_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
8106 #define IOC_IOCFG26_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
8107 #define IOC_IOCFG26_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
8108 
8109 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
8110 //
8111 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
8112 // ENUMs:
8113 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
8114 // POS Positive edge detection
8115 // NEG Negative edge detection
8116 // NONE No edge detection
8117 #define IOC_IOCFG26_EDGE_DET_W 2
8118 #define IOC_IOCFG26_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
8119 #define IOC_IOCFG26_EDGE_DET_S 16
8120 #define IOC_IOCFG26_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
8121 #define IOC_IOCFG26_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
8122 #define IOC_IOCFG26_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
8123 #define IOC_IOCFG26_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
8124 
8125 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
8126 //
8127 // Pull control
8128 // ENUMs:
8129 // DIS No pull
8130 // UP Pull up
8131 // DWN Pull down
8132 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PULL_CTL_W 2
8133 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
8134 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PULL_CTL_S 13
8135 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
8136 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
8137 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
8138 
8139 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
8140 //
8141 // 0: Normal slew rate
8142 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
8143 #define IOC_IOCFG26_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
8144 #define IOC_IOCFG26_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
8145 #define IOC_IOCFG26_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
8146 #define IOC_IOCFG26_SLEW_RED_S 12
8147 
8148 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
8149 //
8150 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
8151 // ENUMs:
8152 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
8153 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
8154 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
8155 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
8156 // to AUTO
8157 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
8158 // to AUTO
8159 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOCURR_W 2
8160 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
8161 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOCURR_S 10
8162 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
8163 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
8164 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
8165 
8166 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
8167 //
8168 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
8169 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
8170 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
8171 // ENUMs:
8172 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
8173 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
8174 // values)
8175 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
8176 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
8177 // values)
8178 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
8179 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
8180 // values)
8181 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
8182 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
8183 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOSTR_W 2
8184 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
8185 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOSTR_S 8
8186 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
8187 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
8188 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
8189 #define IOC_IOCFG26_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
8190 
8191 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
8192 //
8193 // Selects usage for DIO26
8194 // ENUMs:
8195 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
8196 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
8197 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
8198 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
8199 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
8200 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
8201 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
8202 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
8203 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
8204 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
8205 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
8206 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
8207 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
8208 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
8209 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
8210 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
8211 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
8212 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
8213 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
8214 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
8215 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
8216 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
8217 // Can be used as a general
8218 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8219 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8220 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8221 // etc
8222 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
8223 // Can be used as a general
8224 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8225 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8226 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8227 // etc
8228 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
8229 // Can be used as a general
8230 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8231 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8232 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8233 // etc
8234 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
8235 // Can be used as a general
8236 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8237 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8238 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8239 // etc
8240 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
8241 // Can be used as a general
8242 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8243 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8244 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8245 // etc
8246 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
8247 // Can be used as a general
8248 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8249 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8250 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8251 // etc
8252 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
8253 // Can be used as a general
8254 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8255 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8256 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8257 // etc
8258 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
8259 // Can be used as a general
8260 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8261 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8262 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8263 // etc
8264 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
8265 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
8266 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
8267 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
8268 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
8269 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
8270 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
8271 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
8272 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
8273 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
8274 // AUX_IO AUX IO
8275 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
8276 // GPIO General Purpose IO
8277 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_W 6
8278 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
8279 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_S 0
8280 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
8281 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
8282 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
8283 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
8284 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
8285 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
8286 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
8287 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
8288 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
8289 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
8290 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
8291 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
8292 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
8293 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
8294 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
8295 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
8296 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
8297 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
8298 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
8299 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
8300 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
8301 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
8302 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
8303 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
8304 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
8305 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
8306 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
8307 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
8308 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
8309 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_UART0_RTS 0x00000012
8310 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_UART0_CTS 0x00000011
8311 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
8312 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
8313 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
8314 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
8315 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
8316 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
8317 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
8318 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
8319 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
8320 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
8321 #define IOC_IOCFG26_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
8322 
8323 //*****************************************************************************
8324 //
8325 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG27
8326 //
8327 //*****************************************************************************
8328 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
8329 //
8330 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
8331 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
8332 #define IOC_IOCFG27_HYST_EN 0x40000000
8333 #define IOC_IOCFG27_HYST_EN_BITN 30
8334 #define IOC_IOCFG27_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
8335 #define IOC_IOCFG27_HYST_EN_S 30
8336 
8337 // Field: [29] IE
8338 //
8339 // 0: Input disabled
8340 // 1: Input enabled
8341 //
8342 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
8343 // ignored.
8344 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IE 0x20000000
8345 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IE_BITN 29
8346 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IE_M 0x20000000
8347 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IE_S 29
8348 
8349 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
8350 //
8351 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
8352 // or >0x08:
8353 //
8354 // 00: No wake-up
8355 // 01: No wake-up
8356 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
8357 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
8358 //
8359 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
8360 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
8361 //
8362 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
8363 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
8364 //
8365 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
8366 //
8367 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
8368 // DIO.
8369 #define IOC_IOCFG27_WU_CFG_W 2
8370 #define IOC_IOCFG27_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
8371 #define IOC_IOCFG27_WU_CFG_S 27
8372 
8373 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
8374 //
8375 // IO Mode
8376 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
8377 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
8378 //
8379 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
8380 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
8381 // ENUMs:
8382 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
8383 // Inverted input / output
8384 // OPENSRC Open Source
8385 // Normal input / output
8386 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
8387 // Inverted input / output
8388 // OPENDR Open Drain,
8389 // Normal input / output
8390 // INV Inverted input / ouput
8391 // NORMAL Normal input / output
8392 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOMODE_W 3
8393 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
8394 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOMODE_S 24
8395 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
8396 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
8397 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
8398 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
8399 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
8400 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
8401 
8402 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
8403 //
8404 // 0: No interrupt generation
8405 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
8406 // enabled)
8407 #define IOC_IOCFG27_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
8408 #define IOC_IOCFG27_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
8409 #define IOC_IOCFG27_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
8410 #define IOC_IOCFG27_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
8411 
8412 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
8413 //
8414 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
8415 // ENUMs:
8416 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
8417 // POS Positive edge detection
8418 // NEG Negative edge detection
8419 // NONE No edge detection
8420 #define IOC_IOCFG27_EDGE_DET_W 2
8421 #define IOC_IOCFG27_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
8422 #define IOC_IOCFG27_EDGE_DET_S 16
8423 #define IOC_IOCFG27_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
8424 #define IOC_IOCFG27_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
8425 #define IOC_IOCFG27_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
8426 #define IOC_IOCFG27_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
8427 
8428 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
8429 //
8430 // Pull control
8431 // ENUMs:
8432 // DIS No pull
8433 // UP Pull up
8434 // DWN Pull down
8435 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PULL_CTL_W 2
8436 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
8437 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PULL_CTL_S 13
8438 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
8439 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
8440 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
8441 
8442 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
8443 //
8444 // 0: Normal slew rate
8445 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
8446 #define IOC_IOCFG27_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
8447 #define IOC_IOCFG27_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
8448 #define IOC_IOCFG27_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
8449 #define IOC_IOCFG27_SLEW_RED_S 12
8450 
8451 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
8452 //
8453 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
8454 // ENUMs:
8455 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
8456 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
8457 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
8458 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
8459 // to AUTO
8460 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
8461 // to AUTO
8462 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOCURR_W 2
8463 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
8464 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOCURR_S 10
8465 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
8466 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
8467 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
8468 
8469 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
8470 //
8471 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
8472 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
8473 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
8474 // ENUMs:
8475 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
8476 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
8477 // values)
8478 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
8479 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
8480 // values)
8481 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
8482 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
8483 // values)
8484 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
8485 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
8486 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOSTR_W 2
8487 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
8488 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOSTR_S 8
8489 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
8490 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
8491 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
8492 #define IOC_IOCFG27_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
8493 
8494 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
8495 //
8496 // Selects usage for DIO27
8497 // ENUMs:
8498 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
8499 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
8500 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
8501 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
8502 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
8503 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
8504 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
8505 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
8506 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
8507 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
8508 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
8509 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
8510 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
8511 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
8512 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
8513 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
8514 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
8515 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
8516 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
8517 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
8518 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
8519 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
8520 // Can be used as a general
8521 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8522 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8523 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8524 // etc
8525 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
8526 // Can be used as a general
8527 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8528 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8529 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8530 // etc
8531 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
8532 // Can be used as a general
8533 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8534 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8535 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8536 // etc
8537 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
8538 // Can be used as a general
8539 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8540 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8541 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8542 // etc
8543 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
8544 // Can be used as a general
8545 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8546 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8547 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8548 // etc
8549 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
8550 // Can be used as a general
8551 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8552 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8553 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8554 // etc
8555 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
8556 // Can be used as a general
8557 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8558 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8559 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8560 // etc
8561 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
8562 // Can be used as a general
8563 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8564 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8565 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8566 // etc
8567 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
8568 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
8569 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
8570 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
8571 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
8572 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
8573 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
8574 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
8575 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
8576 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
8577 // AUX_IO AUX IO
8578 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
8579 // GPIO General Purpose IO
8580 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_W 6
8581 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
8582 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_S 0
8583 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
8584 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
8585 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
8586 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
8587 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
8588 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
8589 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
8590 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
8591 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
8592 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
8593 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
8594 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
8595 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
8596 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
8597 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
8598 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
8599 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
8600 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
8601 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
8602 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
8603 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
8604 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
8605 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
8606 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
8607 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
8608 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
8609 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
8610 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
8611 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
8612 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_UART0_RTS 0x00000012
8613 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_UART0_CTS 0x00000011
8614 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
8615 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
8616 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
8617 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
8618 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
8619 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
8620 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
8621 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
8622 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
8623 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
8624 #define IOC_IOCFG27_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
8625 
8626 //*****************************************************************************
8627 //
8628 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG28
8629 //
8630 //*****************************************************************************
8631 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
8632 //
8633 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
8634 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
8635 #define IOC_IOCFG28_HYST_EN 0x40000000
8636 #define IOC_IOCFG28_HYST_EN_BITN 30
8637 #define IOC_IOCFG28_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
8638 #define IOC_IOCFG28_HYST_EN_S 30
8639 
8640 // Field: [29] IE
8641 //
8642 // 0: Input disabled
8643 // 1: Input enabled
8644 //
8645 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
8646 // ignored.
8647 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IE 0x20000000
8648 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IE_BITN 29
8649 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IE_M 0x20000000
8650 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IE_S 29
8651 
8652 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
8653 //
8654 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
8655 // or >0x08:
8656 //
8657 // 00: No wake-up
8658 // 01: No wake-up
8659 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
8660 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
8661 //
8662 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
8663 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
8664 //
8665 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
8666 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
8667 //
8668 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
8669 //
8670 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
8671 // DIO.
8672 #define IOC_IOCFG28_WU_CFG_W 2
8673 #define IOC_IOCFG28_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
8674 #define IOC_IOCFG28_WU_CFG_S 27
8675 
8676 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
8677 //
8678 // IO Mode
8679 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
8680 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
8681 //
8682 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
8683 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
8684 // ENUMs:
8685 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
8686 // Inverted input / output
8687 // OPENSRC Open Source
8688 // Normal input / output
8689 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
8690 // Inverted input / output
8691 // OPENDR Open Drain,
8692 // Normal input / output
8693 // INV Inverted input / ouput
8694 // NORMAL Normal input / output
8695 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOMODE_W 3
8696 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
8697 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOMODE_S 24
8698 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
8699 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
8700 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
8701 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
8702 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
8703 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
8704 
8705 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
8706 //
8707 // 0: No interrupt generation
8708 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
8709 // enabled)
8710 #define IOC_IOCFG28_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
8711 #define IOC_IOCFG28_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
8712 #define IOC_IOCFG28_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
8713 #define IOC_IOCFG28_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
8714 
8715 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
8716 //
8717 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
8718 // ENUMs:
8719 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
8720 // POS Positive edge detection
8721 // NEG Negative edge detection
8722 // NONE No edge detection
8723 #define IOC_IOCFG28_EDGE_DET_W 2
8724 #define IOC_IOCFG28_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
8725 #define IOC_IOCFG28_EDGE_DET_S 16
8726 #define IOC_IOCFG28_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
8727 #define IOC_IOCFG28_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
8728 #define IOC_IOCFG28_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
8729 #define IOC_IOCFG28_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
8730 
8731 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
8732 //
8733 // Pull control
8734 // ENUMs:
8735 // DIS No pull
8736 // UP Pull up
8737 // DWN Pull down
8738 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PULL_CTL_W 2
8739 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
8740 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PULL_CTL_S 13
8741 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
8742 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
8743 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
8744 
8745 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
8746 //
8747 // 0: Normal slew rate
8748 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
8749 #define IOC_IOCFG28_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
8750 #define IOC_IOCFG28_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
8751 #define IOC_IOCFG28_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
8752 #define IOC_IOCFG28_SLEW_RED_S 12
8753 
8754 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
8755 //
8756 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
8757 // ENUMs:
8758 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
8759 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
8760 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
8761 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
8762 // to AUTO
8763 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
8764 // to AUTO
8765 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOCURR_W 2
8766 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
8767 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOCURR_S 10
8768 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
8769 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
8770 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
8771 
8772 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
8773 //
8774 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
8775 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
8776 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
8777 // ENUMs:
8778 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
8779 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
8780 // values)
8781 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
8782 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
8783 // values)
8784 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
8785 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
8786 // values)
8787 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
8788 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
8789 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOSTR_W 2
8790 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
8791 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOSTR_S 8
8792 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
8793 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
8794 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
8795 #define IOC_IOCFG28_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
8796 
8797 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
8798 //
8799 // Selects usage for DIO28
8800 // ENUMs:
8801 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
8802 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
8803 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
8804 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
8805 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
8806 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
8807 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
8808 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
8809 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
8810 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
8811 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
8812 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
8813 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
8814 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
8815 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
8816 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
8817 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
8818 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
8819 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
8820 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
8821 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
8822 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
8823 // Can be used as a general
8824 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8825 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8826 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8827 // etc
8828 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
8829 // Can be used as a general
8830 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8831 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8832 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8833 // etc
8834 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
8835 // Can be used as a general
8836 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8837 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8838 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8839 // etc
8840 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
8841 // Can be used as a general
8842 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8843 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8844 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8845 // etc
8846 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
8847 // Can be used as a general
8848 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8849 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8850 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8851 // etc
8852 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
8853 // Can be used as a general
8854 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8855 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8856 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8857 // etc
8858 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
8859 // Can be used as a general
8860 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8861 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8862 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8863 // etc
8864 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
8865 // Can be used as a general
8866 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
8867 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
8868 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
8869 // etc
8870 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
8871 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
8872 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
8873 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
8874 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
8875 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
8876 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
8877 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
8878 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
8879 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
8880 // AUX_IO AUX IO
8881 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
8882 // GPIO General Purpose IO
8883 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_W 6
8884 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
8885 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_S 0
8886 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
8887 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
8888 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
8889 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
8890 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
8891 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
8892 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
8893 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
8894 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
8895 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
8896 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
8897 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
8898 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
8899 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
8900 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
8901 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
8902 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
8903 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
8904 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
8905 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
8906 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
8907 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
8908 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
8909 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
8910 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
8911 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
8912 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
8913 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
8914 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
8915 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_UART0_RTS 0x00000012
8916 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_UART0_CTS 0x00000011
8917 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
8918 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
8919 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
8920 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
8921 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
8922 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
8923 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
8924 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
8925 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
8926 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
8927 #define IOC_IOCFG28_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
8928 
8929 //*****************************************************************************
8930 //
8931 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG29
8932 //
8933 //*****************************************************************************
8934 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
8935 //
8936 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
8937 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
8938 #define IOC_IOCFG29_HYST_EN 0x40000000
8939 #define IOC_IOCFG29_HYST_EN_BITN 30
8940 #define IOC_IOCFG29_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
8941 #define IOC_IOCFG29_HYST_EN_S 30
8942 
8943 // Field: [29] IE
8944 //
8945 // 0: Input disabled
8946 // 1: Input enabled
8947 //
8948 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
8949 // ignored.
8950 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IE 0x20000000
8951 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IE_BITN 29
8952 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IE_M 0x20000000
8953 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IE_S 29
8954 
8955 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
8956 //
8957 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
8958 // or >0x08:
8959 //
8960 // 00: No wake-up
8961 // 01: No wake-up
8962 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
8963 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
8964 //
8965 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
8966 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
8967 //
8968 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
8969 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
8970 //
8971 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
8972 //
8973 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
8974 // DIO.
8975 #define IOC_IOCFG29_WU_CFG_W 2
8976 #define IOC_IOCFG29_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
8977 #define IOC_IOCFG29_WU_CFG_S 27
8978 
8979 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
8980 //
8981 // IO Mode
8982 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
8983 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
8984 //
8985 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
8986 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
8987 // ENUMs:
8988 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
8989 // Inverted input / output
8990 // OPENSRC Open Source
8991 // Normal input / output
8992 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
8993 // Inverted input / output
8994 // OPENDR Open Drain,
8995 // Normal input / output
8996 // INV Inverted input / ouput
8997 // NORMAL Normal input / output
8998 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOMODE_W 3
8999 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
9000 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOMODE_S 24
9001 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
9002 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
9003 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
9004 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
9005 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
9006 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
9007 
9008 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
9009 //
9010 // 0: No interrupt generation
9011 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
9012 // enabled)
9013 #define IOC_IOCFG29_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
9014 #define IOC_IOCFG29_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
9015 #define IOC_IOCFG29_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
9016 #define IOC_IOCFG29_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
9017 
9018 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
9019 //
9020 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
9021 // ENUMs:
9022 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
9023 // POS Positive edge detection
9024 // NEG Negative edge detection
9025 // NONE No edge detection
9026 #define IOC_IOCFG29_EDGE_DET_W 2
9027 #define IOC_IOCFG29_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
9028 #define IOC_IOCFG29_EDGE_DET_S 16
9029 #define IOC_IOCFG29_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
9030 #define IOC_IOCFG29_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
9031 #define IOC_IOCFG29_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
9032 #define IOC_IOCFG29_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
9033 
9034 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
9035 //
9036 // Pull control
9037 // ENUMs:
9038 // DIS No pull
9039 // UP Pull up
9040 // DWN Pull down
9041 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PULL_CTL_W 2
9042 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
9043 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PULL_CTL_S 13
9044 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
9045 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
9046 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
9047 
9048 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
9049 //
9050 // 0: Normal slew rate
9051 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
9052 #define IOC_IOCFG29_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
9053 #define IOC_IOCFG29_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
9054 #define IOC_IOCFG29_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
9055 #define IOC_IOCFG29_SLEW_RED_S 12
9056 
9057 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
9058 //
9059 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
9060 // ENUMs:
9061 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
9062 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
9063 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
9064 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
9065 // to AUTO
9066 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
9067 // to AUTO
9068 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOCURR_W 2
9069 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
9070 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOCURR_S 10
9071 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
9072 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
9073 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
9074 
9075 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
9076 //
9077 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
9078 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
9079 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
9080 // ENUMs:
9081 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
9082 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
9083 // values)
9084 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
9085 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
9086 // values)
9087 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
9088 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
9089 // values)
9090 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
9091 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
9092 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOSTR_W 2
9093 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
9094 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOSTR_S 8
9095 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
9096 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
9097 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
9098 #define IOC_IOCFG29_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
9099 
9100 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
9101 //
9102 // Selects usage for DIO29
9103 // ENUMs:
9104 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
9105 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
9106 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
9107 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
9108 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
9109 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
9110 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
9111 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
9112 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
9113 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
9114 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
9115 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
9116 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
9117 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
9118 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
9119 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
9120 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
9121 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
9122 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
9123 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
9124 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
9125 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
9126 // Can be used as a general
9127 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9128 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9129 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9130 // etc
9131 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
9132 // Can be used as a general
9133 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9134 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9135 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9136 // etc
9137 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
9138 // Can be used as a general
9139 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9140 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9141 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9142 // etc
9143 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
9144 // Can be used as a general
9145 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9146 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9147 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9148 // etc
9149 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
9150 // Can be used as a general
9151 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9152 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9153 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9154 // etc
9155 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
9156 // Can be used as a general
9157 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9158 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9159 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9160 // etc
9161 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
9162 // Can be used as a general
9163 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9164 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9165 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9166 // etc
9167 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
9168 // Can be used as a general
9169 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9170 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9171 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9172 // etc
9173 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
9174 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
9175 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
9176 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
9177 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
9178 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
9179 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
9180 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
9181 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
9182 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
9183 // AUX_IO AUX IO
9184 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
9185 // GPIO General Purpose IO
9186 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_W 6
9187 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
9188 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_S 0
9189 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
9190 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
9191 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
9192 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
9193 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
9194 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
9195 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
9196 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
9197 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
9198 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
9199 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
9200 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
9201 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
9202 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
9203 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
9204 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
9205 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
9206 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
9207 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
9208 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
9209 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
9210 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
9211 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
9212 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
9213 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
9214 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
9215 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
9216 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
9217 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
9218 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_UART0_RTS 0x00000012
9219 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_UART0_CTS 0x00000011
9220 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
9221 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
9222 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
9223 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
9224 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
9225 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
9226 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
9227 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
9228 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
9229 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
9230 #define IOC_IOCFG29_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
9231 
9232 //*****************************************************************************
9233 //
9234 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG30
9235 //
9236 //*****************************************************************************
9237 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
9238 //
9239 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
9240 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
9241 #define IOC_IOCFG30_HYST_EN 0x40000000
9242 #define IOC_IOCFG30_HYST_EN_BITN 30
9243 #define IOC_IOCFG30_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
9244 #define IOC_IOCFG30_HYST_EN_S 30
9245 
9246 // Field: [29] IE
9247 //
9248 // 0: Input disabled
9249 // 1: Input enabled
9250 //
9251 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
9252 // ignored.
9253 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IE 0x20000000
9254 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IE_BITN 29
9255 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IE_M 0x20000000
9256 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IE_S 29
9257 
9258 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
9259 //
9260 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
9261 // or >0x08:
9262 //
9263 // 00: No wake-up
9264 // 01: No wake-up
9265 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
9266 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
9267 //
9268 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
9269 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
9270 //
9271 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
9272 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
9273 //
9274 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
9275 //
9276 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
9277 // DIO.
9278 #define IOC_IOCFG30_WU_CFG_W 2
9279 #define IOC_IOCFG30_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
9280 #define IOC_IOCFG30_WU_CFG_S 27
9281 
9282 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
9283 //
9284 // IO Mode
9285 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
9286 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
9287 //
9288 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
9289 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
9290 // ENUMs:
9291 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
9292 // Inverted input / output
9293 // OPENSRC Open Source
9294 // Normal input / output
9295 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
9296 // Inverted input / output
9297 // OPENDR Open Drain,
9298 // Normal input / output
9299 // INV Inverted input / ouput
9300 // NORMAL Normal input / output
9301 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOMODE_W 3
9302 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
9303 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOMODE_S 24
9304 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
9305 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
9306 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
9307 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
9308 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
9309 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
9310 
9311 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
9312 //
9313 // 0: No interrupt generation
9314 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
9315 // enabled)
9316 #define IOC_IOCFG30_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
9317 #define IOC_IOCFG30_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
9318 #define IOC_IOCFG30_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
9319 #define IOC_IOCFG30_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
9320 
9321 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
9322 //
9323 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
9324 // ENUMs:
9325 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
9326 // POS Positive edge detection
9327 // NEG Negative edge detection
9328 // NONE No edge detection
9329 #define IOC_IOCFG30_EDGE_DET_W 2
9330 #define IOC_IOCFG30_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
9331 #define IOC_IOCFG30_EDGE_DET_S 16
9332 #define IOC_IOCFG30_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
9333 #define IOC_IOCFG30_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
9334 #define IOC_IOCFG30_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
9335 #define IOC_IOCFG30_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
9336 
9337 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
9338 //
9339 // Pull control
9340 // ENUMs:
9341 // DIS No pull
9342 // UP Pull up
9343 // DWN Pull down
9344 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PULL_CTL_W 2
9345 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
9346 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PULL_CTL_S 13
9347 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
9348 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
9349 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
9350 
9351 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
9352 //
9353 // 0: Normal slew rate
9354 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
9355 #define IOC_IOCFG30_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
9356 #define IOC_IOCFG30_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
9357 #define IOC_IOCFG30_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
9358 #define IOC_IOCFG30_SLEW_RED_S 12
9359 
9360 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
9361 //
9362 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
9363 // ENUMs:
9364 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
9365 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
9366 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
9367 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
9368 // to AUTO
9369 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
9370 // to AUTO
9371 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOCURR_W 2
9372 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
9373 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOCURR_S 10
9374 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
9375 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
9376 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
9377 
9378 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
9379 //
9380 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
9381 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
9382 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
9383 // ENUMs:
9384 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
9385 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
9386 // values)
9387 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
9388 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
9389 // values)
9390 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
9391 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
9392 // values)
9393 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
9394 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
9395 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOSTR_W 2
9396 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
9397 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOSTR_S 8
9398 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
9399 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
9400 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
9401 #define IOC_IOCFG30_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
9402 
9403 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
9404 //
9405 // Selects usage for DIO30
9406 // ENUMs:
9407 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
9408 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
9409 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
9410 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
9411 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
9412 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
9413 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
9414 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
9415 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
9416 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
9417 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
9418 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
9419 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
9420 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
9421 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
9422 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
9423 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
9424 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
9425 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
9426 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
9427 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
9428 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
9429 // Can be used as a general
9430 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9431 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9432 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9433 // etc
9434 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
9435 // Can be used as a general
9436 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9437 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9438 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9439 // etc
9440 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
9441 // Can be used as a general
9442 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9443 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9444 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9445 // etc
9446 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
9447 // Can be used as a general
9448 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9449 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9450 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9451 // etc
9452 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
9453 // Can be used as a general
9454 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9455 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9456 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9457 // etc
9458 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
9459 // Can be used as a general
9460 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9461 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9462 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9463 // etc
9464 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
9465 // Can be used as a general
9466 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9467 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9468 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9469 // etc
9470 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
9471 // Can be used as a general
9472 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9473 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9474 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9475 // etc
9476 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
9477 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
9478 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
9479 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
9480 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
9481 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
9482 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
9483 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
9484 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
9485 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
9486 // AUX_IO AUX IO
9487 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
9488 // GPIO General Purpose IO
9489 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_W 6
9490 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
9491 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_S 0
9492 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
9493 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
9494 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
9495 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
9496 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
9497 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
9498 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
9499 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
9500 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
9501 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
9502 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_RFC_TRC 0x0000002E
9503 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_I2S_MCLK 0x00000029
9504 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_I2S_BCLK 0x00000028
9505 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_I2S_WCLK 0x00000027
9506 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_I2S_AD1 0x00000026
9507 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_I2S_AD0 0x00000025
9508 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_SSI1_CLK 0x00000024
9509 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_SSI1_FSS 0x00000023
9510 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_SSI1_TX 0x00000022
9511 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_SSI1_RX 0x00000021
9512 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_CPU_SWV 0x00000020
9513 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT7 0x0000001E
9514 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT6 0x0000001D
9515 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT5 0x0000001C
9516 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT4 0x0000001B
9517 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT3 0x0000001A
9518 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT2 0x00000019
9519 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT1 0x00000018
9520 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_PORT_EVENT0 0x00000017
9521 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_UART0_RTS 0x00000012
9522 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_UART0_CTS 0x00000011
9523 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_UART0_TX 0x00000010
9524 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_UART0_RX 0x0000000F
9525 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSCL 0x0000000E
9526 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_I2C_MSSDA 0x0000000D
9527 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_SSI0_CLK 0x0000000C
9528 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_SSI0_FSS 0x0000000B
9529 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_SSI0_TX 0x0000000A
9530 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_SSI0_RX 0x00000009
9531 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_AUX_IO 0x00000008
9532 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_AON_CLK32K 0x00000007
9533 #define IOC_IOCFG30_PORT_ID_GPIO 0x00000000
9534 
9535 //*****************************************************************************
9536 //
9537 // Register: IOC_O_IOCFG31
9538 //
9539 //*****************************************************************************
9540 // Field: [30] HYST_EN
9541 //
9542 // 0: Input hysteresis disable
9543 // 1: Input hysteresis enable
9544 #define IOC_IOCFG31_HYST_EN 0x40000000
9545 #define IOC_IOCFG31_HYST_EN_BITN 30
9546 #define IOC_IOCFG31_HYST_EN_M 0x40000000
9547 #define IOC_IOCFG31_HYST_EN_S 30
9548 
9549 // Field: [29] IE
9550 //
9551 // 0: Input disabled
9552 // 1: Input enabled
9553 //
9554 // Note: If IO is configured for AUX ie. PORT_ID = 0x08, the enable will be
9555 // ignored.
9556 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IE 0x20000000
9557 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IE_BITN 29
9558 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IE_M 0x20000000
9559 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IE_S 29
9560 
9561 // Field: [28:27] WU_CFG
9562 //
9563 // If DIO is configured GPIO or non-AON peripheral signals, i.e. PORT_ID 0x00
9564 // or >0x08:
9565 //
9566 // 00: No wake-up
9567 // 01: No wake-up
9568 // 10: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going low.
9569 // 11: Wakes up from shutdown if this pad is going high.
9570 //
9571 // If IO is configured for AON peripheral signals or AUX ie. PORT_ID
9572 // 0x01-0x08, this register only sets wakeup enable or not.
9573 //
9574 // 00, 01: Wakeup disabled
9575 // 10, 11: Wakeup enabled
9576 //
9577 // Polarity is controlled from AON registers.
9578 //
9579 // Note:When the MSB is set, the IOC will deactivate the output enable for the
9580 // DIO.
9581 #define IOC_IOCFG31_WU_CFG_W 2
9582 #define IOC_IOCFG31_WU_CFG_M 0x18000000
9583 #define IOC_IOCFG31_WU_CFG_S 27
9584 
9585 // Field: [26:24] IOMODE
9586 //
9587 // IO Mode
9588 // N/A for IO configured for AON periph. signals and AUX ie. PORT_ID 0x01-0x08
9589 // AUX has its own open_source/drain configuration.
9590 //
9591 // 0x2: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
9592 // 0x3: Reserved. Undefined behavior.
9593 // ENUMs:
9594 // OPENSRC_INV Open Source
9595 // Inverted input / output
9596 // OPENSRC Open Source
9597 // Normal input / output
9598 // OPENDR_INV Open Drain
9599 // Inverted input / output
9600 // OPENDR Open Drain,
9601 // Normal input / output
9602 // INV Inverted input / ouput
9603 // NORMAL Normal input / output
9604 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOMODE_W 3
9605 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOMODE_M 0x07000000
9606 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOMODE_S 24
9607 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOMODE_OPENSRC_INV 0x07000000
9608 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOMODE_OPENSRC 0x06000000
9609 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOMODE_OPENDR_INV 0x05000000
9610 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOMODE_OPENDR 0x04000000
9611 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOMODE_INV 0x01000000
9612 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOMODE_NORMAL 0x00000000
9613 
9614 // Field: [18] EDGE_IRQ_EN
9615 //
9616 // 0: No interrupt generation
9617 // 1: Enable interrupt generation for this IO (Only effective if EDGE_DET is
9618 // enabled)
9619 #define IOC_IOCFG31_EDGE_IRQ_EN 0x00040000
9620 #define IOC_IOCFG31_EDGE_IRQ_EN_BITN 18
9621 #define IOC_IOCFG31_EDGE_IRQ_EN_M 0x00040000
9622 #define IOC_IOCFG31_EDGE_IRQ_EN_S 18
9623 
9624 // Field: [17:16] EDGE_DET
9625 //
9626 // Enable generation of edge detection events on this IO
9627 // ENUMs:
9628 // BOTH Positive and negative edge detection
9629 // POS Positive edge detection
9630 // NEG Negative edge detection
9631 // NONE No edge detection
9632 #define IOC_IOCFG31_EDGE_DET_W 2
9633 #define IOC_IOCFG31_EDGE_DET_M 0x00030000
9634 #define IOC_IOCFG31_EDGE_DET_S 16
9635 #define IOC_IOCFG31_EDGE_DET_BOTH 0x00030000
9636 #define IOC_IOCFG31_EDGE_DET_POS 0x00020000
9637 #define IOC_IOCFG31_EDGE_DET_NEG 0x00010000
9638 #define IOC_IOCFG31_EDGE_DET_NONE 0x00000000
9639 
9640 // Field: [14:13] PULL_CTL
9641 //
9642 // Pull control
9643 // ENUMs:
9644 // DIS No pull
9645 // UP Pull up
9646 // DWN Pull down
9647 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PULL_CTL_W 2
9648 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PULL_CTL_M 0x00006000
9649 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PULL_CTL_S 13
9650 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PULL_CTL_DIS 0x00006000
9651 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PULL_CTL_UP 0x00004000
9652 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PULL_CTL_DWN 0x00002000
9653 
9654 // Field: [12] SLEW_RED
9655 //
9656 // 0: Normal slew rate
9657 // 1: Enables reduced slew rate in output driver.
9658 #define IOC_IOCFG31_SLEW_RED 0x00001000
9659 #define IOC_IOCFG31_SLEW_RED_BITN 12
9660 #define IOC_IOCFG31_SLEW_RED_M 0x00001000
9661 #define IOC_IOCFG31_SLEW_RED_S 12
9662 
9663 // Field: [11:10] IOCURR
9664 //
9665 // Selects IO current mode of this IO.
9666 // ENUMs:
9667 // 4_8MA Extended-Current (EC) mode: Min 8 mA for double
9668 // drive strength IOs (min 4 mA for normal IOs)
9669 // when IOSTR is set to AUTO
9670 // 4MA High-Current (HC) mode: Min 4 mA when IOSTR is set
9671 // to AUTO
9672 // 2MA Low-Current (LC) mode: Min 2 mA when IOSTR is set
9673 // to AUTO
9674 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOCURR_W 2
9675 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOCURR_M 0x00000C00
9676 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOCURR_S 10
9677 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOCURR_4_8MA 0x00000800
9678 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOCURR_4MA 0x00000400
9679 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOCURR_2MA 0x00000000
9680 
9681 // Field: [9:8] IOSTR
9682 //
9683 // Select source for drive strength control of this IO.
9684 // This setting controls the drive strength of the Low-Current (LC) mode.
9685 // Higher drive strength can be selected in IOCURR
9686 // ENUMs:
9687 // MAX Maximum drive strength, controlled by
9688 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMAX (min 2 mA @1.8V with default
9689 // values)
9690 // MED Medium drive strength, controlled by
9691 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMED (min 2 mA @2.5V with default
9692 // values)
9693 // MIN Minimum drive strength, controlled by
9694 // AON_IOC:IOSTRMIN (min 2 mA @3.3V with default
9695 // values)
9696 // AUTO Automatic drive strength, controlled by AON BATMON
9697 // based on battery voltage. (min 2 mA @VDDS)
9698 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOSTR_W 2
9699 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOSTR_M 0x00000300
9700 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOSTR_S 8
9701 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOSTR_MAX 0x00000300
9702 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOSTR_MED 0x00000200
9703 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOSTR_MIN 0x00000100
9704 #define IOC_IOCFG31_IOSTR_AUTO 0x00000000
9705 
9706 // Field: [5:0] PORT_ID
9707 //
9708 // Selects usage for DIO31
9709 // ENUMs:
9710 // RFC_SMI_CL_IN RF Core SMI Command Link In
9711 // RFC_SMI_CL_OUT RF Core SMI Command Link Out
9712 // RFC_SMI_DL_IN RF Core SMI Data Link In
9713 // RFC_SMI_DL_OUT RF Core SMI Data Link Out
9714 // RFC_GPI1 RF Core Data In 1
9715 // RFC_GPI0 RF Core Data In 0
9716 // RFC_GPO3 RF Core Data Out 3
9717 // RFC_GPO2 RF Core Data Out 2
9718 // RFC_GPO1 RF Core Data Out 1
9719 // RFC_GPO0 RF Core Data Out 0
9720 // RFC_TRC RF Core Trace
9721 // I2S_MCLK I2S MCLK
9722 // I2S_BCLK I2S BCLK
9723 // I2S_WCLK I2S WCLK
9724 // I2S_AD1 I2S Data 1
9725 // I2S_AD0 I2S Data 0
9726 // SSI1_CLK SSI1 CLK
9727 // SSI1_FSS SSI1 FSS
9728 // SSI1_TX SSI1 TX
9729 // SSI1_RX SSI1 RX
9730 // CPU_SWV CPU SWV
9731 // PORT_EVENT7 PORT EVENT 7
9732 // Can be used as a general
9733 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9734 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9735 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9736 // etc
9737 // PORT_EVENT6 PORT EVENT 6
9738 // Can be used as a general
9739 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9740 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9741 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9742 // etc
9743 // PORT_EVENT5 PORT EVENT 5
9744 // Can be used as a general
9745 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9746 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9747 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9748 // etc
9749 // PORT_EVENT4 PORT EVENT 4
9750 // Can be used as a general
9751 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9752 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9753 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9754 // etc
9755 // PORT_EVENT3 PORT EVENT 3
9756 // Can be used as a general
9757 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9758 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9759 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9760 // etc
9761 // PORT_EVENT2 PORT EVENT 2
9762 // Can be used as a general
9763 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9764 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9765 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9766 // etc
9767 // PORT_EVENT1 PORT EVENT 1
9768 // Can be used as a general
9769 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9770 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9771 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9772 // etc
9773 // PORT_EVENT0 PORT EVENT 0
9774 // Can be used as a general
9775 // purpose IO event by selecting it via registers
9776 // in the EVENT module, e.g.
9777 // EVENT:GPT0ACAPTSEL.EV, EVENT:UDMACH14BSEL.EV,
9778 // etc
9779 // UART0_RTS UART0 RTS
9780 // UART0_CTS UART0 CTS
9781 // UART0_TX UART0 TX
9782 // UART0_RX UART0 RX
9783 // I2C_MSSCL I2C Clock
9784 // I2C_MSSDA I2C Data
9785 // SSI0_CLK SSI0 CLK
9786 // SSI0_FSS SSI0 FSS
9787 // SSI0_TX SSI0 TX
9788 // SSI0_RX SSI0 RX
9789 // AUX_IO AUX IO
9790 // AON_CLK32K AON 32 KHz clock (SCLK_LF)
9791 // GPIO General Purpose IO
9792 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_W 6
9793 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_M 0x0000003F
9794 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_S 0
9795 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_IN 0x00000038
9796 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_CL_OUT 0x00000037
9797 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_IN 0x00000036
9798 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_RFC_SMI_DL_OUT 0x00000035
9799 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI1 0x00000034
9800 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_RFC_GPI0 0x00000033
9801 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO3 0x00000032
9802 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO2 0x00000031
9803 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO1 0x00000030
9804 #define IOC_IOCFG31_PORT_ID_RFC_GPO0 0x0000002F
